newsitem.title: USA: Chip equipment sales seen down to $24.5 bln in '97.
newsitem.headline: Chip equipment sales seen down to $24.5 bln in '97.

text.p: Worldwide semiconductor equipment sales are expected to fall 5.5 percent to $25.4 billion in 1997 from an expected $26.8 billion in 1996, a survey of the semiconductor equipment industry found.
The survey, which included input from 85 companies in the U.S., Europe and Japan, said the expected slip would be due to excess capacity.

The survey found that by 1998, however, the industry should absorb the excess capacity and report sales of about $29 billion. Sales were $24 billion in 1995, the group conducting the survey -- Semiconductor Equipment and Materials -- said.
